conclusion: To find the magnitude of the Ampere force, consider contributions from each wire segment.
Ampere force formula: F = I L x B.
Wire is folded into a right-angle with segments ac = L and cd = 2L.
Magnetic field B is perpendicular to the plane of the wire.
Force on segment ac is perpendicular to both ac and B.
Force on segment cd is perpendicular to both cd and B.
Calculate force on segment ac: Fac = I * L * B.
Calculate force on segment cd: Fcd = I * 2L * B.
Direction of force on ac is perpendicular to ac and B, directed out of or into the plane.
Direction of force on cd is perpendicular to cd and B, directed out of or into the plane.
Add forces vectorially: Ftotal = Fac + Fcd = I * 3L * B.
Final answer: Magnitude of Ampere force is F = 3I L B.
